Auto kill any blocking sessions over 5 mins in Staples Preferred: Staples Preferred is sensitive application to business and any job that blocks other session can cause website hang issues. This action was taken as permanent solution after a P1 outage occurred, to kill any blocking session held for more than 5 mins and prevent further outages.

Identify and reporting of  long held locks in WMOS : Though not blocking, but long held locks used to cause application session unresponsive. For over a long period of time, many swat calls were opened and sessions killed after identifying them. I created a script to send alert to application team and DBA for any long held locks. This prevents situation to get worse and identify issues before they escalate.

dbsnmp password rotation scripts: dbsnmp account is used for DB monitoring via OEM. There was no process in place earlier. I created scripts to perform rotation in Database as well as update it in OEM.

OEM reports for unavailable targets: Earlier, we used to get alert(which is one time generated) for any target when it goes down. But there were cases when those alerts were not handled. This repetitive report identifies any such unhandled scenarios

SYSAUX growth report & purge logic for trail: With the introduction of standard audit policy, there was need for continuously monitor SYSAUX tablespace and its growth. I created and scheduled a script to report such trend and verify whether the purge logic is working as expected.

PSU patching automation: There is quarterly PSU patching performed on all production and non-production databases. I created a script that can be run from a central server to patch unused oracle home before downtime.

Manual refresh procedure for RAC database: For RAC database setups, where there is firewall enabled between non-prod and prod, we cannot use standard duplicate command for refresh. I created a standard process to follow for all such refreshes. This activity earlier used to take unncessary extra hours causing much delay in deliverables.

audit package deployed and users created for all databases: In order to be complaint to quarterly SOX audits, we implemented an audit policy across all databases to maintain audit trail and purge it after a certain retention. Also individual DBA accounts were created, so that DBA activity can be audited as well.
Weekly Audit scripts: In order to be complaint to quarterly SOX audits, I created and scheudled scripts to report any complaince breach and take corrective actions before auditors catch this.

Storage requirement report: This was  an initiative for capacity planning. There was no system in place to report storage requirement for FS extension based on historical database growth trends. Created this report which will take into account past 6 months database growth and estimate whether more space is needed to provision.

GG shutdown/startup scripts for GDW backup: During weekly Teradata Dev and Prod, there was a need to stop all replication in place. To do this activity, created a script that could stop/start all replicates, disable/enable monitoring and record a history of such actions.

Unified auditing identification and disable. Stopped SYSAUX growth and new storage needs: In 12c, there is unified auditing is enabled by default and cause SYSAUX tables to grow fast.As staples moved towards 12c version of databases, this went unnoticed and we added GBs of space to tablespace. This was identified and fixed for Top usage databases.
